6.Pros: A very Nice place to work

7.Pros: The training and experience gained as an assistant/General manager can be used to land better paying jobs if you sell the experience properly.
7.Cons: Typically low pay, and unaffordable health insurance when it's offered at all. Assistant managers are usually hourly, but are expected to always be on call and available to handle issues as if they were salaried.

8.Pros: Good benefits, favorite brand of many
8.Cons: Inconsistent policies dependent on manager or department, red tape

9.Summary: "I had a really good time working at McDonald's."
9.Pros: Things were serious but fun at the same time. Everybody worked as a team, from the GM all the way down to the crew.
9.Cons: The money was not very good and the hours were bad. Customers weren't always the nicest people in the world either.
